Description: Oblong piece of sandstone, divided in two parts by a straight longitude groove all around the sides, certainly for attaching a string. The function of the item remains unknown, maybe a net-sinker, a small loom-weight, a kind of rough plummet for a plumb line, or simply a handle.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.81, p.186, pl.28)
